locutie.beschrijving: The preacher recounts a personal anecdote about an airplane seat, explains the historical context of the 'great ordeal' in Revelation, and retells the story of Peter raising Dorcas.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong narrative flow; connects the vulnerability of the Lamb to the socio-political context of the Roman Empire.

illocutie.beschrijving: The primary force is ASSERTING (describing the world of the text) with a secondary force of COMMANDING (inviting small decisions).
voorbeelden: The book of Revelation is about a big decision.
The poetry of Revelation is an insistence that the world is not the way the empire says it is.
It is good news for us.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To encourage the hearer to see their small moral choices as part of a larger cosmic/theological struggle.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low; the Spirit is not explicitly mentioned as the agent of the 'event'.

voorbeelden: The great ordeal was experienced by those who suffered.
The Jesus movement was a threat.
The true story is the story of God.
Who knows? It might allow making decisions...
It is good news for us.
He will guide them to springs of the water of life.
God will wipe away every tear.
commissieven.kwaliteit: The promises are quoted from Scripture (3rd person) rather than spoken directly from God to the hearer (2nd person).

declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher acts as a commentator on the gospel rather than an authorized herald of it.

indicatoren: Extensive historical description of the Roman Empire.
The use of 'I have thought about' instead of 'Thus says the Lord'.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a historical or poetic reality rather than a participant in a current event.

missende_elementen: Direct promise ('I promise you in His name')
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is left to apply the 'information' to their own life via 'small decisions' (moralism).

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Rhetorical questions ('Do I have to tell you?').

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the Empire, the Saints, Peter, and Dorcas.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (The story of Peter) -> Directive (We must make small decisions).
voorbeelden: When we make the big decision... all of our little decisions follow.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The 'event' is replaced by a call to human willpower (decisions).

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Missing the direct Commissive/Declarative link to the hearer.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: The Lamb has defeated the empire! ... It might even cause me to give up an aisle seat.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a brilliant socio-political and theological lecture on the Book of Revelation, but fails to 'happen' as a sacramental encounter because it remains in the third person.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The great ordeal was administered and enacted by the severe agents of order...

zwakke_punten.probleem: The promise is 'about' them, not 'to' you.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is a talk about an event (the Resurrection/Revelation) rather than being an event itself.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher does not use his mandate to declare anything new into the life of the listener.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: No; God is the object of the sermon.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: No; the preacher is an observer/analyst.
tekstueel_bewijs: So I have thought about the 'great ordeal'...

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly relies on human 'decisions' rather than the Spirit's work.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: No; sermon as a motivational tool.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many past-tense assertives. Needs present-tense commissives and declaratives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The Lamb will guide them to springs of water.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, the Lamb guides YOU to the water of life; drink and live.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: Promises are kept in the future tense or the third person.
voorbeeldzinnen: I promise you today: the empire does not have the final word over your life.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the congregation as the saints.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the ones coming out of the ordeal.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The imperative (small decisions) is not rooted in a present-tense indicative (God's act for you).
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Declare the victory of the Lamb over the hearer's specific 'ordeals' before asking for a decision.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is intellectually stimulating but homiletically 'stuck' in the constative. To move toward a sacramental event, the preacher must dare to speak for God in the second person.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (the airplane story); SAT reveals that this story remains a constative assertive that doesn't actually 'do' anything for the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, the 'empire' imagery is powerful; however, SAT shows the illocutionary force is descriptive rather than transformative.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT exposes that the sermon's 'eventfulness' is hindered by its grammatical distance (3rd person, past tense).

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: God will wipe away every tear from their eyes.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'indicative of the past' rather than the 'indicative of the present'.
